poem:
**Fraternal Gates**

In the mansion of shadows,  
where echoes linger,  
time ticks like embers. 

Brothers stand,  
one step from freedom,  
one step from damnation. 

Chains of memory  
clink against the bars —  
a game between walls,  
a fate played on loop. 

Thirty years gone,  
yet the mansion stands,  
locked in the hearts of men.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Lyle Menendez to face California parole board after brother Erik denied freedom Lyle Menendez is set to face a California parole board a day after his brother was denied freedom after spending 30 years in prison in the slaying of their parents inside their California mansion. A panel of two California commissioners denied Erik Menendez parole for three years, after which he will be eligible again, in a case that continues to fascinate the public.". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Lyle Menendez to face California parole board after brother Erik denied freedom Lyle Menendez is set to face a California parole board a day after his brother was denied freedom after spending 30 years in prison in the slaying of their parents inside their California mansion. A panel of two California commissioners denied Erik Menendez parole for three years, after which he will be eligible again, in a case that continues to fascinate the public.
